title: Did Dunkin’ change how we spell ‘donut’?
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Wickedpedia The coffee chain’s choice of spelling decades ago may have shaped how we write "doughnut" today.
This photo provided by Dunkin' Donuts shows a selection of the doughnuts they sell.
(AP Photo/Dunkin' Donuts) Every New Englander loves Dunkin’— but did you know the brand may be the reason you spell the word “doughnut” as “donut”?

title: Bruins’ struggles continue with blowout loss to Senators 7-2
author: The Associated Press
bullets: Boston Bruins Jeremy Swayman made 17 saves for the Bruins, who are in last place in the Atlantic Division.
Ottawa Senators' Ridly Greig, center, hits the Bruins' Henri Jokiharju during the second-period.

Sean Kilpatrick/The Canadian Press via AP OTTAWA, Ontario (AP) — Drake Batherson and Tim Stutzle each had two goals and an assist to lead the Ottawa Senators over the Boston Bruins 7-2 on Monday night for their third straight win.

title: DCF releases new details about its involvement with Conn. girl found dead in storage container
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News “To correct misinformation,” DCF released a timeline of their involvement with Jacqueline “Mimi” Torres-Garcia.
Her mother, aunt, and mother's boyfriend are facing charges in her death.
Jacqueline “Mimi” Torres-Garcia.
